title: How to Draw an Anime Cat Girl

steps.headline: Draw some guidelines.
steps.description: A circle for the head, with two triangular shapes on top for the ears.

steps.headline: Add the guidelines for the center of the circle.
steps.description: This will be used to determine where the features are going to be.

steps.headline: Add a couple of circles for where the eyes are going to be.
Add the guidelines for the hair.
steps.description: This can just be a simple shape, just to outline what the hair is going to look like.

steps.headline: Add the chin and the rest of the facial features, including the ears.
Detail the hair.
steps.description: With anime, hair doesn't need too much detail, just enough to give it some character.

steps.headline: Fill out the eyes.
steps.description: Anime eyes are probably the hardest part for most beginners to do right, and they probably need a tutorial of their own.

steps.headline: Erase any all the guidelines that you don't need, and you're done!

tyn: If you don't want to use paper, use photoshop on a tablet or a computer.
text: Draw some guidelines. A circle for the head, with two triangular shapes on top for the ears. Add the guidelines for the center of the circle. This will be used to determine where the features are going to be. Add a couple of circles for where the eyes are going to be.  Add the guidelines for the hair. This can just be a simple shape, just to outline what the hair is going to look like. Add the chin and the rest of the facial features, including the ears.  Detail the hair. With anime, hair doesn't need too much detail, just enough to give it some character. Fill out the eyes. Anime eyes are probably the hardest part for most beginners to do right, and they probably need a tutorial of their own. Erase any all the guidelines that you don't need, and you're done!  Finished just add some colour.
sentences: A circle for the head, with two triangular shapes on top for the ears.
Add the guidelines for the center of the circle.
This will be used to determine where the features are going to be.
Add a couple of circles for where the eyes are going to be.
Add the guidelines for the hair.
This can just be a simple shape, just to outline what the hair is going to look like.
Add the chin and the rest of the facial features, including the ears.
With anime, hair doesn't need too much detail, just enough to give it some character.
Anime eyes are probably the hardest part for most beginners to do right, and they probably need a tutorial of their own.
Erase any all the guidelines that you don't need, and you're done!
